channel.title: Compiler Help
channel.description: Ok so i'm using Sagi-X Evolution client, and I edited some sprites and other things in the client, and when I go to compile it says, Error: Could not find or load main class Animable.java Press any key to continue . . . I'm not sure what the problem is because my animable.java is there.. it's odd. Please no irrelevant posts.

item.title: Compiler Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:8, topic:471236”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=588774.msg4174159#msg4174159 date=1354760477]

[quote]@echo off
Title Building…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_09\bin\java.exe” *.java
pause[/quote]

Yeah, okay, with that. You’re compiler shouldn’t be getting errors. Is it your Run.bat giving errors?
[/quote]
Java.exe is not the compiler. It should be javac.exe.[/quote]
Shit… I didn’t even see that…

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Help
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:471236”][quote author=Camballer link=topic=588774.msg4174146#msg4174146 date=1354758740]

[quote]@echo off
Title Building…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_09\bin\java.exe” *.java
pause[/quote]
[/quote]
Yeah, okay, with that. You’re compiler shouldn’t be getting errors. Is it your Run.bat giving errors?[/quote]
Java.exe is not the compiler. It should be javac.exe.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Help
item.dc:creator: @T_h_3 T h 3
item.description:
@T_h_3 wrote:

[quote=“Camballer, post:1, topic:471236”]Ok so i’m using Sagi-X Evolution client, and I edited some sprites and other things in the client, and when I go to compile it says,
Error: Could not find or load main class Animable.java
Press any key to continue . .
. I’m not sure what the problem is because my animable.java is there… it’s odd.
Please no irrelevant posts.[/quote]

Best bet is to get another basic Sagi-X Client and compile it. Re-add your sprites one by one while compiling till you find out where you went wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

the only thing I could think of is if your animable.java wasn’t in the same directory as everything else.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Help
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

Nope client runs smoothly, but when I wanna change the client, I can’t because the compiler doesn’t work…

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Camballer, post:3, topic:471236”][quote]@echo off
Title Building…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_09\bin\java.exe” *.java
pause[/quote][/quote]
Yeah, okay, with that. You’re compiler shouldn’t be getting errors. Is it your Run.bat giving errors?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

@echo off Title Building... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_09\bin\java.exe" *.java pause

item.title: Compiler Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Right click it, select edit. Check where it’s trying to load the missing class from.
Change it to the correct directory if wrong. I’d assume it’s wrong if it isn’t finding it.

Read full topic

Press any key to continue . .
